This is a numerical simulation of diffusion limited aggregation growth process. This is a process of a growth of a structure, where building blocks delivery rate is limited by diffusion. The diffusion is here simulated by random walk of particles - more information on that technique can be found at Wikipedia.

Some more details may be found at

  • Wikipedia will tell you about physical aspects of the process
  • The coding Train shows more illustrative, yet not so efficient implementation of the process
You may play with the simulation by changing some of the parameters with sliders at the top of the page while observing an influence on the aggregate's shape
  • drift North-South / Ease-West - sets the probability of jumps for aggregating particles toward a specified direction
  • Stick probability - sets the probability that a particle with stick to the aggregate once it is about to aggregate
